sandbox_1_tactical_10.baseItemName: Wasteland Cache: Support First Aid Kit

sandbox_1_building_37.buildingUnlockDesc: Unlocks after obtaining all Gitmalutu Gala Champ Badges

alchemy_lv1.unlockDesc: Unlock by deploying Level I or higher [Metal Mint]

alchemy_lv2.unlockDesc: Unlock by deploying Level II or higher [Metal Mint]

alchemy_lv3.unlockDesc: Unlock by deploying Level III or higher [Metal Mint]

sandbox_1_food_28.itemUsage: Gain status resistance, Max HP +50%, DEF +50%
sandbox_1_food_28.enhancedUsage: Gain status resistance, Max HP +75%, DEF +75%

sandbox_1_food_35.itemUsage: On skill activation, other Operators that have eaten this food recover 2 SP
sandbox_1_food_35.enhancedUsage: On skill activation, other Operators that have eaten this food recover 3 SP

sandbox_1_food_38.itemUsage: +2 Block, gains +100% DEF Tenacity (reaches maximum bonus when missing 50% Max HP)
sandbox_1_food_38.enhancedUsage: +2 Block, gains +150% DEF Tenacity (reaches maximum bonus when missing 50% Max HP)

sandbox_1_food_39.itemUsage: Operator is more likely to be attacked, gains +50% DEF and 20% Physical and Arts dodge
sandbox_1_food_39.enhancedUsage: Operator is more likely to be attacked, gains +75% DEF and 40% Physical and Arts dodge

sandbox_1_food_40.itemUsage: Gain Vigor effect of +50% ATK when HP is above 80%
sandbox_1_food_40.enhancedUsage: Gain Vigor effect of +70% ATK when HP is above 50%

sandbox_1_food_41.generalName: Sausage and Bean Paste Cube α
sandbox_1_food_41.enhancedName: Sausage and Bean Paste Cube β
sandbox_1_food_41.itemUsage: ASPD +5 after defeating an enemy, stacks up to 10 times (effect lost when retreated)
sandbox_1_food_41.enhancedUsage: ASPD +7 after defeating an enemy, stacks up to 10 times (effect lost when retreated)

sandbox_1_food_43.itemUsage: Allies within the Operator's Attack Range gain natural SP recovery +0.4/s (does not stack) and increased healing received by 15%
sandbox_1_food_43.enhancedUsage: Allies within the Operator's Attack Range gain natural SP recovery +0.5/s (does not stack) and increased healing received by 30%

sandbox_1_food_44.itemUsage: Operator gains 1 SP every 6 seconds, but automatically activates skill

node_upgrade_battle.name: Headquarter
node_upgrade_battle.description: When less than 10% of a non-Boss Raid passes through this Zone, they are all automatically annihilated; Operator ATK+15% when fighting in this Zone
node_upgrade_battle.upgradeDesc: Place 2 Level 2 or higher Defensive Constructs in a Zone

node_upgrade_scout.name: Sentry
node_upgrade_scout.description: In this zone, enemy Movement Speed -15%, and Operator Deployment Time -8%
node_upgrade_scout.upgradeDesc: Place 2 Level 2 or higher Detector Constructs in a Zone

weather_normal.name: Sunny
weather_normal.description: A fine day with clear weather.

weather_thunder_storm.name: Thunderstorm
weather_thunder_storm.functionDesc: Deals 20 Corrosion damage to all Operators every second; Lightning strikes 2 random tiles (range can overlap) every 40 seconds, dealing 800 True damage to units (excluding Constructs) on those tiles within a cross area; Crabbie Pumpie SP recovery +0.2/s
weather_thunder_storm.description: Thunder and lightning flash right before your eyes. To go out at this time, are you perhaps testing your luck against the elements?

weather_thunder.name: Thunderburst
weather_thunder.functionDesc: Lightning strikes 1 random tile every 40 seconds, dealing 800 True damage to units (excluding Constructs) on the tile within a cross area; Crabbie Pumpie SP recovery +0.15/s
weather_thunder.description: Its said that lightning tends to strike unlucky people...

weather_acid_rain.name: Acid Rain
weather_acid_rain.functionDesc: Deals 20 Corrosion Damage to all Operators every second; Crabbie Pumpie SP recovery +0.1/s
weather_acid_rain.description: The rain pours down a mix of dangerous elements absorbed from the earth, sparing not even the steel and iron machinery.

weather_rainforest_normal.name: Sunny
weather_rainforest_normal.description: A fine day with clear weather.

weather_heat_wave.name: Scorching Sun
weather_heat_wave.functionDesc: Operators are stunned for 10s every 50s; afflicted with [Combustion] (receiving 50 Arts and Burn damage per second, does not stack and can be resisted) for 20s every 30s; All [Wild Beasts] Max HP -15%
weather_heat_wave.description: Weather that makes one wonder if this is what being baked feels like. If you stand outside for a while, you can feel your blood literally boiling.

weather_heat.name: Bright Sun
weather_heat.functionDesc: Operators are afflicted with [Combustion] (receiving 50 Arts and Burn damage per second, does not stack and can be resisted) for 10s every 30s; All [Wild Beasts] Max HP -10%
weather_heat.description: Prolonged exposure to sunlight makes the ground hot enough to fry eggs, so be careful not to get sunburned while outside!

weather_hot.name: Hot Weather
weather_hot.functionDesc: Operators are stunned for 10s every 50s; All [Wild Beasts] Max HP -5%
weather_hot.description: Dizziness, blurred vision, confusion... the weather is too hot, please try to stay alert.

weather_volcano_normal.name: Sunny
weather_volcano_normal.description: A fine day with clear weather.

weather_big_sandstorm.name: Habūb
weather_big_sandstorm.functionDesc: Operator Redeployment Time +50%; A sandstorm starts blowing in a random direction when the mission begins, and allied units caught in the sandstorm will have -50 ASPD. Constructs and other Operators can block the sandstorm to negate the effects; enemy Movement Speed -15%
weather_big_sandstorm.description: Being caught in such a fierce gale full of sand will not just hinder your movements!

weather_sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
weather_sandstorm.functionDesc: A sandstorm starts blowing in a random direction when the mission begins, and allied units caught in the sandstorm will have -30 ASPD. Constructs and other Operators can block the sandstorm to negate the effects; enemy Movement Speed -10%
weather_sandstorm.description: A storm in such a dry place makes sand and dust your biggest obstacle. Unless you have constructs or... someone else to cover you.

weather_drought.name: Drought
weather_drought.functionDesc: Allied Operator Redeployment Time +50%; enemy Movement Speed -5%
weather_drought.description: Staying dehydrated for too long will deplete everyone's energy.

weather_desert_normal.name: Sunny
weather_desert_normal.description: A fine day with clear weather.

sandbox_1_01.name: Shrubbery Galore
sandbox_1_01.description: The land beneath the shade of the trees nourishes all kinds of creatures you wouldn't expect to see here. A gentle breeze blows, and fowlbeast figures blend into the leaves. Sitting in the shade here for just a moment will leave you refreshed.

sandbox_1_02.name: Rugged Rock Hillock
sandbox_1_02.description: The winding paths here lead to different areas, every route as familiar as home to the miners. The tedious, oppressive, and sweat-drenched life—as well as the overseers' supervision—are all 'gifts' bestowed upon them by the lords ameer.

sandbox_1_03.name: Ironsmelt Core
sandbox_1_03.description: Unknown forces occupy the iron veins meandering between the lava, and the tremendous heat drenches everyone in sweat. The lords ameer's tradition of clamoring after resources has packed this place full of people, and a fight is about to break out.

sandbox_1_04.name: Looking for Lighting
sandbox_1_04.description: Miners are heading deeper into the cave in search of Lighting Ore. The mineral's high price compels everyone to take more risks and venture deeper into undiscovered strata.

sandbox_1_05.name: Cavern of Screams
sandbox_1_05.description: Exploring an undiscovered cave is like opening a package from an unknown sender—you never know if you'll find a pleasant surprise or a horrifying shock.

sandbox_1_06.name: 'Greeting Gallery'
sandbox_1_06.description: In the torrid heat of Sargon, naturally cool caves are places of competition. Much like a hotel, if you 'accidentally' open the wrong 'room,' you may suffer the occupant's wrath.

sandbox_1_07.name: 'Treasury'
sandbox_1_07.description: Rich ore veins are often found side by side with danger. The cave miners are working their hardest, and the best way to preserve the fruits of their labor is to hold off any uninvited intruders.

sandbox_1_08.name: Treasure Cove
sandbox_1_08.description: Rugged reefs drive turbulent undercurrents under otherwise calm waters, but what appears above the surface is equally fierce. This is obviously an easy fortress to guard, but difficult to attack.

sandbox_1_09.name: Gathering of Feathers
sandbox_1_09.description: Wherever there are trees there are fowlbeasts, so perhaps it's not a bad idea to bring them both home.

sandbox_1_10.name: Rippling Wasteland
sandbox_1_10.description: During the Lush and Drought seasons of Sargon, the lives of the common people fare much like the grass in the wastelands during the same seasons. The only constant you'll find are ameeri forces on patrol, threatening everyone equally with their weapons.

sandbox_1_11.name: Crab Den Isle
sandbox_1_11.description: Metal crabs constantly move along with the rise and fall of the tides on this deserted island. If you pay attention, they always appear and vanish from fixed positions. What's going on?

sandbox_1_12.name: Confusing Quagmire
sandbox_1_12.description: Ameeri forces aren't necessarily familiar with their territory, let alone anywhere locals rarely visit. Fortunately, this means no one will be starving away in this creature-infested swamp, at the very least.

sandbox_1_13.name: Sacrificial Spot
sandbox_1_13.description: The tribesmen are conducting an ancient ceremony. A shadow flashes by during the bizarre rite, and a show is about to begin.

sandbox_1_14.name: Firerock Pass
sandbox_1_14.description:
<@lv.description><Olden Keystone></> Unlocks access to next region when destroyed. Will always start at full HP when entering the map. 
 It looks like a completely different area up ahead. The land rises up, sputtering lava all over. Everything will end in chaos and scorching heat.

sandbox_1_15.name: Emerald Pass
sandbox_1_15.description:
<@lv.description><Olden Keystone></> Unlocks access to next region when destroyed. Will always start at full HP when entering the map. 
 It looks like a completely different area up ahead. The lake and mud obstruct both our march and our vision. Everything will end in hallucinations and silence.

sandbox_1_16.name: Mineshaft Crawl
sandbox_1_16.description:
Ancient ore deposits interlinked with one another were once witnesses to Arsalan's prosperity, but are now also the silent bearers of today's turmoil. 
<@lv.description>No melee/ranged deployment restrictions in this Operation </>

sandbox_1_17.name: Peak Deviation
sandbox_1_17.description: Your journey is full of forks in the road that may affect you or even others. No matter which path you take, you must bear the consequences of your choice.

sandbox_1_18.name: Olden Site of the Zümrütrüyası
sandbox_1_18.description:
<@lv.description>Enemies refresh every day. If the Boss Enemy is not defeated, HP recovers to full the next day (excluding Strange Territory) </>
An ancient temple stands at the water's edge. They lie in wait for us, anticipating our bewilderment and our request for refuge.

sandbox_1_19.name: Tovlama of the Rings of Fire
sandbox_1_19.description:
<@lv.description>Enemies refresh every day. If the Boss Enemy is not defeated, HP recovers to full the next day (excluding Strange Territory) </>
As their audience, the acrobats' performance was a sight to behold. Now as their opponents, it's time to be dizzied by their combat abilities.

sandbox_1_20.name: Predestined End
sandbox_1_20.description:
<@lv.description>Enemies refresh every day. If the Boss Enemy is not defeated, HP recovers to full the next day (excluding Strange Territory) </>
Putting an end to the fate bestowed by this great land is the sole reason we have come here.

sandbox_1_21.name: Alt Taraf of the Spring of Flight
sandbox_1_21.description:
<@lv.description>Enemies refresh every day. If the Boss Enemy is not defeated, HP recovers to full the next day (excluding Strange Territory) </>
Under an icy waterfall lies a buried secret. It is warm, gentle, and for some carries a hint of melancholy as it drifts in their minds. The mere mention turns the atmosphere to grief.

sandbox_1_22.name: Clinking Crystals
sandbox_1_22.description:
<@lv.description>Enemies refresh every day. If the Boss Enemy is not defeated, HP recovers to full the next day (excluding Strange Territory) </>
The crystal cave's environment created all of this, including the latent life within waiting to be released, perhaps to warn outsiders of a danger beyond recognition.

sandbox_1_23.name: Deep Rift Valley
sandbox_1_23.description: Shrouded in fog and unfathomable darkness, the lords in this land follow only their hearts.

sandbox_1_24.name: Wide-Open Interception Point
sandbox_1_24.description: The wind of the Rabum-Arakeeshtu jungle has lost direction here, the sparse rocks surrounding the only guardians left on the flat wastes.

sandbox_1_25.name: Mountainous Interception Point
sandbox_1_25.description: The water of the Eqlumuy Oasis pools and runs off from here, the subtle flow performing solo in the lofty mountain valley.

sandbox_1_26.name: Desolate Interception Point
sandbox_1_26.description: The buildings standing here when Narutabatim was still boat-friendly have worn away with time, the slightly salty sand a witness to all.

sandbox_1_27.name: Headquarters
sandbox_1_27.description: The first foothold. It may not be luxurious, but it can let us rest in peace. We need only protect this spot, and no matter how many times we fail, we can still get back on our feet.

sandbox_1_28.name: Uhummish
sandbox_1_28.description:
<@lv.description><Command Point></> Once destroyed, you can periodically dispatch Operators to collect large quantities of Wood 
'Like a cascade of cliffs,' is what the people call the place. It was once a thriving forestry town, but now there are only unknown forces taking lives in the silent woods.

sandbox_1_29.name: Burutabatum
sandbox_1_29.description:
<@lv.description><Command Point></> Once destroyed, you can periodically dispatch Operators to collect large quantities of Stone 
 'Olden Sweetwater Course' was the nickname given to this town in its glory days, but today it no longer exists, gone with the once flowing Narutabatim river. Sweet water? Only the endless desert and small patches of forest can be seen.

sandbox_1_30.name: Namutumbatsim
sandbox_1_30.description:
<@lv.description><Command Point></> Once destroyed, you can periodically dispatch Operators to collect large quantities of Wood and some Stone 
'Jest of the sands' was a nickname bestowed by travelers to the area. They say when miners still frequented the place, you could stand on the tallest construct and see foreign landscapes looming on the horizon.

sandbox_1_31.name: Betabulli-Apkalli
sandbox_1_31.description:
<@lv.description><Command Point></> Once destroyed, you can periodically dispatch Operators to collect large quantities of Iron Ore
'Sage's gate' was an old moniker given to this place. It is said a sage once resided here, but with so many similar stories in Sargon, people only remember it as a mining town.

sandbox_1_32.name: Forward Camp
sandbox_1_32.description: We can set up camp once we unpack all the resources we have in the car. Sometimes it can exert an unimaginable strength in battle.

sandbox_1_33.name: Gathering Grounds
sandbox_1_33.description: Where the sea of sand meets the jungle and oasis, the heart of the lost Szubat-Arsalan.

sandbox_1_34.name: Hunting Lesson
sandbox_1_34.description: Finding food is the first step of survival. Everything else is meaningless without subsistence.

sandbox_1_35.name: Gathering Lesson
sandbox_1_35.description: Extraction is the first step of construction. Development is worthless without resources.

sandbox_1_36.name: Equipment Lesson
sandbox_1_36.description: Tool-use is the first step of civilization. Everyone is shackled by inefficiency without tools.

sandbox_1_37.name: Masters of the Forest
sandbox_1_37.description: The wild beasts and insects do not claim to be masters of the forest, as the splendor of life belongs to nature. However, the humans with jewels on their hands think otherwise.

sandbox_1_38.name: Jagged Jungle
sandbox_1_38.description: The locals guard their precious timber with their patrols. The more huts to shelter them from the elements, the fewer people getting sick from the cold.

sandbox_1_39.name: Logging Taxation
sandbox_1_39.description: It is extremely normal to cut down the available trees, but the Lord Ameer decreed an unusual tax rate, so everyone tried to sneak around it.

sandbox_1_40.name: Within Range
sandbox_1_40.description: It is said some miserly lords would rather fell the trees here with ballistae than let the tribes cut them down. To this end, they've even let loose some wild beasts here.

sandbox_1_41.name: Treasure in the Trees
sandbox_1_41.description: Hidden within the woods seems to be a secret path leading deeper in—is this the fabled 'treasure'? Doesn't that sound a bit too convenient?

sandbox_1_42.name: Experimentation Site
sandbox_1_42.description: What leaps out from the forest can be prey, foes, or even unidentified mechanical equipment.

sandbox_1_43.name: Numbly Homebound
sandbox_1_43.description: These Originium Infected aberrations have not completely lost their minds, but they stand in front of their former nests, mechanically repeating the act of going home.

sandbox_1_44.name: Defending Nature
sandbox_1_44.description: In the eyes of many Sargonians, protecting the natural environment is more important than anything else, so they react very aggressively to any kind of change in their lives.

sandbox_1_45.name: Trade-Off
sandbox_1_45.description: Tribe elders often have an old Sargonian saying to warn their descendants with: those in the tribe who can carry boulders are worthy of respect, but those who build houses from sand are also heroes.

sandbox_1_46.name: Crossroads
sandbox_1_46.description: This mine in the mountains should have been quieter, but on closer inspection turns out to be as clamorous as a commercial district intersection.

sandbox_1_47.name: Vein Guardians
sandbox_1_47.description: The deformed Originium creature quietly guards the rock to its side. It has lost its memory and its sentience, only wanting to guard the ore before it.

sandbox_1_48.name: Rocky Outpost
sandbox_1_48.description: Stones, weeds, and foes—together they 'occupy' this hilltop, becoming the only 'landscape' left on this barren land.

sandbox_1_49.name: Witnessing Chamber
sandbox_1_49.description: The shadows of past and future shed a tear here, proclaiming to the land today that they were here.

sandbox_1_50.name: Consortium of Cragpincers
sandbox_1_50.description: It hurts to be pinched by a Cragpincer, but the pain is nothing compared to the joy of tasting its delicious meat!

sandbox_1_51.name: Critical Defense
sandbox_1_51.description: The most important thing to surviving in the wilderness is always experience. Veteran gatherers need only look at the terrain to know what they should prepare for.

sandbox_1_52.name: Clash of Clans
sandbox_1_52.description: The scramble for ore destroyed the otherwise friendly relations between several tribes, and when they began destroying the Monitoring Tower we had built, anger permeated among us.

sandbox_1_53.name: Originium Slug Invasion
sandbox_1_53.description: The leporibeast's territory was occupied by Originium slugs, and now hunting is more difficult—after all, we have to catch our prey between chain explosions.

sandbox_1_54.name: Primordial Surge
sandbox_1_54.description: The local creatures rumble and roll here and there, again and again—this is their life.

sandbox_1_55.name: Drinkwater as Bait
sandbox_1_55.description: Water is a scarce resource in the non-rainforest regions of Sargon, and sometimes it is more than your favorite quarry that shows up to drink. Act rashly and you might just get...ouch!

sandbox_1_56.name: Straight Into the Abyss
sandbox_1_56.description: The suicidal behavior of this Infected creature only makes you more afraid of Originium, but obviously hunger is more pressing than the risk of illness.

sandbox_1_57.name: Hasty Escape
sandbox_1_57.description: Mossback Beasts are our quarry, but the musbeasts here are none the wiser, and they frantically flee in panic.

sandbox_1_58.name: Invisible Boundaries
sandbox_1_58.description: The mossback beasts leisurely chew on their own moss, wandering at their own pace. Strange, there seems to be a large area just outside, but how come they are never out there?

sandbox_1_59.name: Domestication
sandbox_1_59.description: Some people from a nomadic city tried to employ drones to tame the mossback beasts for travel and cargo transport. The idea was sound, but reality was clearly...

sandbox_1_60.name: Square Arena
sandbox_1_60.description: A seemingly spacious venue is full of all kinds of Sarkaz. Anyone who steps in will experience a no-holds-barred fist-fighting tourney, and only the winners get to survive.

sandbox_1_61.name: The Big Migration
sandbox_1_61.description: As the climate and environment shifted, the beasts crossed the river in droves, heading to the other side where food was more plentiful. Tribes with ample food reserves prefer to act as guides for foreign photographers now, for it is much easier than hunting.

sandbox_1_62.name: Taxed With a Choice
sandbox_1_62.description: When the tribespeople feel crushed under the weight of the Lord Ameer's taxes, some will choose to join the lord's taxation squad. Of course, no matter the choice, it's always for the sake of survival.

sandbox_1_63.name: Towering Pass
sandbox_1_63.description:
<@lv.description><Olden Keystone></> Unlocks access to next region when destroyed. Will always start at full HP when entering the map.
It looks like a completely different area up ahead. The sandstorm gradually intensifies, and boulders clog our path. Everything will end in dehydration and extinction.

sandbox_1_64.name: Uninvited Guest
sandbox_1_64.description: Sargon always gets uninvited visitors. Often they are unfriendly, even more so than the lord ameer's men.

sandbox_1_65.name: Battle Instincts
sandbox_1_65.description: A volcano erupts and heats up the land. Living creatures understand not war, but merely obey their instincts.

sandbox_1_66.name: The Lost 'Zhayedan'
sandbox_1_66.description: The warrior walked alone with sand between his fingers. No one could give him an answer, and he responded to everyone with only silence.

sandbox_1_67.name: The Lost Great Wingbeast
sandbox_1_67.description: If you wish to command nature, you must first obey it. The strange beast wanders around its territory, waiting for the next curious person.

sandbox_1_68.name: Sickness of the Land
sandbox_1_68.description: The land gives birth to lumps of earth, and from the ground grows boulders and sand flying everywhere. Or perhaps it becomes a mountain, or condenses into a statue. Don't be afraid, they might just want to tell you something.

sandbox_1_69.name: Windswept Ravine
sandbox_1_69.description: A piece of land can be either a battlefield or a place of joy to work and live in, depending on how the people on it decide.

sandbox_1_70.name: Field of Gravel
sandbox_1_70.description: You have seen a Sarkaz mercenary sow a few seeds here. Not every seed will sprout, but this plain is already better than the barren land it was before.

sandbox_1_71.name: Rugged Trail
sandbox_1_71.description: An old hunter recounts the story of the first man to eat a cragpincer. Having survived Catastrophes and plundering, he bit into the hard shell without even considering if it was a poisonous creature or a stale fruit. With blood dripping from his mouth, he tasted the sweetness of life.

sandbox_1_72.name: Warrior's Vision
sandbox_1_72.description: Sargonian warriors are keenly aware that everyone has the same pair of eyes, and that what and how much they see with them is the key to victory on the battlefield.

sandbox_1_73.name: Mercenary's Affiliation
sandbox_1_73.description: Sarkaz mercenaries are not a rare sight in the Reefsteep black market, and with their Columbian communicators and Victorian-style weapons they can belong to any force, but never to themselves.

sandbox_1_74.name: Lost Orders
sandbox_1_74.description: Losing a large order of Arts Units is no small matter, and not wanting the buyers to discover the truth, this group of Leithanians decide to act first.

sandbox_1_75.name: Endless Inferno
sandbox_1_75.description: Fire burns the body, and will recasts the soul.

sandbox_1_76.name: Restrained Fury
sandbox_1_76.description: When a lord ameer's taxes finally overwhelmed a poor tribe, some of the tribesmen chose to turn their weapons on you, their fellow oppressed, but there were those still with strength in them. Their anger was restrained, and it stopped here.

sandbox_1_77.name: Cage
sandbox_1_77.description: The acrobats have meticulously decorated this cave into a cage—as for whether what counts as a cage, it depends on who has the key.

sandbox_1_78.name: Riverbed of Suffering
sandbox_1_78.description: Strict security is but a temporary shackle, and dry riverbeds but a distant past. Only real resistance can bring true freedom to the people.

sandbox_1_79.name: Searching for a Path
sandbox_1_79.description: People come and go here freely, as if nothing happens in this spot at all.

sandbox_1_80.name: Skirmish
sandbox_1_80.description: Ameeri forces have been stationed here for a long time, and their acts will be remembered by the people.

sandbox_1_81.name: Headquarters
sandbox_1_81.description: The first foothold. It may not be luxurious, but it can let us rest in peace. We need only protect this spot, and no matter how many times we fail, we can still get back on our feet.

sandbox_1_82.name: 'Greeting Gallery'
sandbox_1_82.description: In the torrid heat of Sargon, naturally cool caves are places of competition. Much like a hotel, if you 'accidentally' open the wrong 'room,' you may suffer the occupant's wrath.

sandbox_1_83.name: 'Treasury'
sandbox_1_83.description: Rich ore veins are often found side by side with danger. The cave miners are working their hardest, and the best way to preserve the fruits of their labor is to hold off any uninvited intruders.

sandbox_1_84.name: Crossroads
sandbox_1_84.description: This mine in the mountains should have been quieter, but on closer inspection turns out to be as clamorous as a commercial district intersection.

sandbox_1_85.name: Slugs Meadow
sandbox_1_85.description:
<@lv.description><Catch Zone> </>Deployed Operators can catch weakened Originium slugs within their attack range.
One of the most well-known spots in the Circle of Gitmalutu where Originium slugs gather. Slugs scuttle through the swaying grass, vanishing instantly into the verdant maze at the slightest approach.

sandbox_1_86.name: Darkreach Cavern
sandbox_1_86.description:
<@lv.description><Catch Zone> </>Deployed Operators can catch weakened Originium slugs within their attack range.
Raise your torch, watch your step, and keep a lookout for slugs or anything strange that might pounce on you!

sandbox_1_87.name: Firegold Cavern
sandbox_1_87.description:
<@lv.description><Catch Zone> </>Deployed Operators can catch weakened Originium slugs within their attack range.
The caverns here resemble the Forbidden Tsalimashtu, but even the scorching magma fails to deter slug hunting adventurers.

sandbox_1_88.name: Eshnunna Marathon
sandbox_1_88.description:
<@lv.description><Booster></>Speeds up your slug for a while!
The Eshnunna Marathon is a unique circuit with its lava covered tracks. Slugs who do not wish to become roasted are advised to speed up.

sandbox_1_89.name: Agra Hairpin Race
sandbox_1_89.description:
<@lv.description><Booster></> Speeds up your slug for a while!
The Agra Hairpin is famous for its winding curves and high injury rate. Risky turns often lead to a chain of tailgate crashes.

sandbox_1_90.name: Urkesh Dash
sandbox_1_90.description:
<@lv.description><Booster></> Speeds up your slug for a while!
The Urkesh Dash has one simple rule: Dash like the wind! Nothing will stand in their way, aside from fellow racers.

sandbox_1_91.name: Duana Bump Race
sandbox_1_91.description:
<@lv.description><Booster></> Speeds up your slug for a while!
<@lv.description><Magnet></> Allows your slug to latch on to a target and move along its direction!
<@lv.description><Vacuum></> Your slug will continuously steal a target's stamina!
As the opener for the second half of the Gala races, the Duana Bump Race features an impressive course. Contestants bump into each other as they vie for the safest position—recklessness will only send them straight into the obstacles or the abyss itself.

sandbox_1_92.name: Gassur City Race
sandbox_1_92.description:
<@lv.description><Booster></> Speeds up your slug for a while!
<@lv.description><Magnet></> Allows your slug to latch on to a target and move along its direction!
<@lv.description><Vacuum></> Your slug will continuously steal a target's stamina!
The Gassur City Race is the most chaotic part of the entire Gala. Just imagine a racetrack full of pedestrians, hawker stalls, and kids throwing fruit peels! Marvelous, isn't it?

sandbox_1_93.name: Raylan Shuttle Run
sandbox_1_93.description:
<@lv.description><Booster></> Speeds up your slug for a while!
<@lv.description><Magnet></> Allows your slug to latch on to a target and move along its direction!
<@lv.description><Vacuum></> Your slug will continuously steal a target's stamina!
The Raylan Shuttle Run has the most complicated racetrack. Here, the contestants play to their respective advantages and shuttle between the various forks in their path towards the same destination.

sandbox_1_94.name: Sippar Hill Climb
sandbox_1_94.description:
<@lv.description><Booster></> Speeds up your slug for a while!
<@lv.description><Magnet></> Allows your slug to latch on to a target and move along its direction!
<@lv.description><Vacuum></> Your slug will continuously steal a target's stamina!
The end of the Gala is just up ahead, as well as the most difficult track. Lava, steam, and steep cliffs are all special 'prizes' for the contestants.

sandbox_1_95.name: 'Useful Info'
sandbox_1_95.description:
<@lv.description><Booster></> Speeds up your slug for a while!
<@lv.description><Magnet></> Allows your slug to latch on to a target and move along its direction!
<@lv.description><Vacuum></> Your slug will continuously steal a target's stamina!
Some useful tips about the Gitmalutu Gala Slug Races...

sandbox_1_96.name: Gitmalutu Pass
sandbox_1_96.description:
<@lv.description><Olden Keystone></> Unlocks access to next region when destroyed. Will always start at full HP when entering the map. 
It looks like a completely different area up ahead. The insects swarm the monoliths as the forest stands in silence. Everything will end in calm and peace.

z_1_3_buff.description: On deployment, Operators are stunned for 25 seconds (can be negated by obtaining a mysterious Token)
z_1_3_buff.extra: A sound coming from nowhere that makes one uneasy

gameConst.baseRushedDesc: Caution! Enemies are attacking our Headquarters!

gameConst.riftBaseRushedDesc: We only have one vehicle, but the supplies in it will be enough to fend off enemy assaults.

basicConst.logisticsEvacuateWarning: Can only re-add Logistics Operators at the start of a new cycle if evacuated, and buffs will be <color=#d12524>lost</color>
basicConst.monthlyEntryRiftText: Cannot challenge while in Strange Territory
basicConst.monthlyRushIntro: Contention Reiteration will use your existing forward camp for simulated Operations, and any damage suffered will not be permanent
exploreModeBuffDescs: Ingredients and Provisions have +100% efficiency when brewed into energy drinks
Raid enemies have 50% reduced ATK and HP
<color=#797717>Above effects do not apply in Strange Territory or Critical Contentions; switching modes will not alter Prosperity Point gain efficiency</color>

riftConst.noTeamDescription: The Strange Territory allows you a special advantage in your exploration. Tactical Tendencies can be upgraded via the Tech Tree.

battleLoadingTips.tip: Usually, each Operator can only join one Operation a day. Operators will be tired after but will recover by the next day
All resources require the corresponding Distribution Chart before you can gather from them, so carefully explore the Arsalan region
Unused Acts will not accumulate over days, so use them carefully
The further out you go, the richer resources you will find, but there will also be more challenges and dangers.
Weather changes in different zones can affect the environment and Operators
As time passes, Raids will appear in the wild and move towards Headquarters with the goal of destroying it
Protecting Headquarters is your highest priority—Raids arriving at Headquarters will activate an Emergency Situation where you will have to handle them before anything else.
Undefeated enemies in a zone will move to the next zone the following day, until they arrive at Headquarters
Your data will be auto-saved on every Calculation Day, and you can load saves of your last 2 Calculation days if required
Drought season will reduce your water and food resource output, so make sure to be prepared
A Base Camp lies near Headquarters where you can sometimes find friends dropping by there, so remember to check regularly
Each of the three [Outposts] has their own characteristics, so make sure to utilize them to better withstand Raids
There are mysterious presences in [No Man's Land]; prepare yourself and you might be able to find rare goods in your explorations
Destroy a [Fortress], and new Raids will no longer spawn from that node
Destroy [Olden Keystones] in [Mountain Pass] nodes to unlock new regions to explore
Upgrading a node will help us defend ourselves from Raids
Raise your Headquarters Level to unlock more content such as Construction Blueprints
In addition to hunting, you can also get food by building [Planting Box Groups]
Raise your Headquarters Level to increase the deployment limit of [Planting Box Groups] and other Constructs in Headquarters
You can smelt materials into Crude Gold after placing a [Metal Mint] in Headquarters
You can directly upgrade existing Constructs when you unlock higher grades of the same Construct.
[Energy Drinks] are an important resource consumed by Operators when they go on Operations. They can be crafted from all sorts of ingredients in the Cooking Platform
You can cook [Provisions] in the Cooking Platform, that can give a temporary buff to the dining Operator
[Seasonings] are valuable minor ingredients that can change Provision effects and extend their shelf life; perhaps you may find more in the [Strange Territory]
The [Trading Post] will restock every Calculation Day, so make sure to check regularly
Speak to special characters you encounter in Reclamation Algorithm to learn more about the tales within the sand
Upgrade Headquarters Level to 3 to unlock Logistics Support, and set Logistics Operators to gain more buffs in battle
Logistics Operators will enter their stations at the start of every cycle; keep your buffs by regularly supplying them with Energy Drinks
After breaching [Deserted Towns] you can periodically dispatch Operators on expeditions, but take note you will be unable to do so if Brigand Raids retake the town
[Deserted Town] expeditions require an Act point, but you can obtain a large quantity of resources, so make sure to check regularly
The [Tech Tree] can help you out in your algorithm, so be sure to regularly research the various techs available
Some nodes in [Tech Tree] require upgrading your Headquarters Level to unlock
The [Strange Territory] is a special independent region where you can obtain rare materials from completing Core Goals
[Crystalline Shards] are a special currency only obtainable from the [Strange Territory]; perhaps the Sunvalley Liaison knows their value
Prepare for your Strange Territory investigation, and you will take the [Campervan] to explore at the end of your current cycle; make sure to check your Forward Camp before you set off
Stragglers will first stay at their spawn point to gather their strength before heading towards your [Headquarters], so make sure to respond in time
Slugs can only be captured in Catch Zones
Use a Slug Trainer for a random new trait

mainline1_2_a.questDesc: We divided the work up—Eunectes will stay at Headquarters while we venture out to gather resources.

mainline1_3.questDesc: We met an old friend while exploring and he showed us the way south.

mainline1_4.questDesc: We arrived at the quarry our friend mentioned, defeated the ameeri forces, and will continue heading south.

mainline1_5.questDesc: We rescued someone who told us she wanted to go to the quarry in the south. Coincidentally, we're also heading south for the salt flats, so perhaps we might meet again.
mainline1_5.questTargetDesc: Explore the salt flats and look for more secrets <color=#d8d769>(survive until day 30)</color>

mainline1_6.questDesc: We experienced many mysterious happenings at the salt flats, but Eunectes back at camp has news for us, so we need to go talk to her.

mainline1_7.questDesc: Ameeri forces are right at our door. We have no choice but to fight them at Headquarters.

mainline2_1.questDesc: We manage to repel them for the time being. They came here for 'treasure,' so what exactly are they looking for? Tuye is looking for us, so let's go talk to her.

mainline2_2.questDesc: We need to head towards the oasis to ask more tribes for help, but where exactly are they? We have to go find them.

mainline2_3.questDesc: We're neither friend nor foe to these local tribes. After we obtain their trust, our next objective will be exploring the oasis.

mainline2_4.questDesc: Under local guidance, we decided to look for the letter's master. Perhaps she knows what the 'treasure' is.
mainline2_4.questTargetDesc: Find the letter's owner in the <color=#d8d769>Eqlumuy Oasis</color>

mainline2_5.questDesc: We catch up to Pepe, and she offers a cooperation agreement. She'll give us more information if we can find the other half of a disk. Reports say <color=#d8d769>a certain island</color> has it.

mainline2_6.questDesc: We are about to delve deeper into this 'treasure' business when Eunectes sends word. She wants to talk to us.

mainline2_7.questDesc: Ameeri forces are intensifying their assaults on our headquarters. We have no choice but to fight.

mainline3_1.questDesc: Figuring out the truth of the 'treasure' might settle our ameeri problem, so we decide to have a chat with Pepe.

mainline3_2.questDesc: The Liaison stops us before we head north, and seems to have something he wants to entrust us with.

mainline3_3.questDesc: The Liaison gave us a little present, but where exactly will it come in handy?

mainline3_4.questDesc: We encountered a group of overly enthusiastic acrobats while on our way north, and it's time we taught them a lesson.

mainline3_5.questDesc: Where exactly is the fabled 'treasure'? We must continue the search.

mainline3_6.questDesc: Ameeri forces are at our doorstep again, and we have to keep them out!

mainline3_7.questDesc: Pepe parts ways with us, and there's news from Eunectes.

mainline3_8.questDesc: The most powerful ameeri forces are right before us, and it's time we showed them who's the strongest around here.
mainline3_8.questTargetDesc: Eliminate the Lord Ameer's elite army

sideline_miner_1.questDesc: Kestrel went to the quarry alone to save her comrades. We'd better help her out.

sideline_miner_2.questDesc: We meet with Kestrel, and it's time to alleviate her comrades' suffering.

sideline_xbele_1.questDesc: We agreed to look for the missing colossus. Let's start our search nearby.

sideline_xbele_2.questDesc: We discover some weird tracks, and follow them northward.

sideline_xbele_3.questDesc: It seems to be right in front of us...

sideline_clking_1.questDesc: We have a new lead: the individual we were looking for on the Liaison's request seems to be the same person mentioned by the acrobats.

sideline_clking_2.questDesc: We make a deal with the acrobats to save the Treasure Hunter, but what they ask for is no ordinary object.
sideline_clking_2.questTargetDesc: Go towards the Gemini Gembeast's habitat

sideline_clking_3.questDesc: Everything is in order. It's time for a showdown with the Gemini Gembeast.

sideline_cook_1.questDesc: The High Priest seems to be in a bad mood. We should go find out what's going on.

sideline_cook_2.questDesc: We decide to placate the High Priest with Crab Porridge, something he might be able to stomach.

sideline_cook_3.questDesc: Our dish was shunned. Let's go ask Tuye for her opinion.

sideline_cook_4.questDesc: We try again with Pressure-Cooked Soup. It's said the dish requires a rare 'Marrow Fungus' along with some Cragpincer Claws—where do we find that sort of thing?

sideline_cook_5.questDesc: Tuye's recommended dish didn't do so well either, and now it's the Liaison's turn.

sideline_cook_6.questDesc: We try again with some Crab Sashimi.

sideline_cook_7.questDesc: Maybe we should ask his bestie Eunectes.

sideline_cook_8.questDesc: We talk to Eunectes, and decide to give her a dish to spice up.

sideline_cook_9.questDesc: Let's serve our Eunectes-style dish to the High Priest.

gacha_line_1.questDesc: The idle Liaison has set up a stall at our base camp...

bonus_crzcrabs_2.questDesc: The metal crabs are coming for us...

bonus_cook_2.questDesc: There are so many problems with our cooking that the High Priest, the 'prolific' culinary master, has had enough and wants to talk.

mainline1a.questLineDesc: Amidst a sandstorm, we managed to reach the location where we planned to build our camp, but the situation surrounding us exceeded our expectations—ameeri forces were crawling everywhere in search of a 'treasure,' and interfering with our work. Luckily, we met some friends, like the old tribe chief and our familiar Sunvalley acquaintance. Finally, we had our first clash with an ameeri army. No one knows for sure what will happen next.

mainline1b.questLineDesc: Amidst a sandstorm, we managed to reach the location where we planned to build our camp, but the situation surrounding us exceeded our expectations—ameeri forces were crawling everywhere in search of a 'treasure,' and interfering with our work. Luckily, we met some friends, like the old tribe chief and our familiar Sunvalley acquaintance. Finally, we had our first clash with an ameeri army. No one knows for sure what will happen next.

mainline2a.questLineDesc: Rhodes Island sent more support—Passenger and other operators have joined us. We headed east towards the Oasis to try and unify the tribes there. A local priestess recommended we cooperate with an archaeologist 'wanted' by ameeri forces, as she might be able to help us figure out what this 'treasure' is exactly. For some reason, the lord ameer launched an assault, so we had no choice but to take care of them first.

mainline2b.questLineDesc: Rhodes Island sent more support—Passenger and other operators have joined us. We headed east towards the Oasis to try and unify the tribes there. A local priestess recommended we cooperate with an archaeologist 'wanted' by ameeri forces, as she might be able to help us figure out what this 'treasure' is exactly. For some reason, the lord ameer launched an assault, so we had no choice but to take care of them first.

mainline3a.questLineDesc: We decided to look for the origin of the 'treasure' to settle our ameeri problem once and for all. We went up north with the archaeologist to the crystal caves where we discovered secrets pertaining to Arsalan and even Sargon, but elite ameer forces showed up for our heads as well. We drove them off, and they acknowledged our strength as well as realized that the 'treasure' here was not what they were looking for. And thus, the crisis in Arsalan came to an end—and we threw a picture-perfect party in celebration.

mainline3b.questLineDesc: We decided to look for the origin of the 'treasure' to settle our ameeri problem once and for all. We went up north with the archaeologist to the crystal caves where we discovered secrets pertaining to Arsalan and even Sargon, but elite ameer forces showed up for our heads as well. We drove them off, and they acknowledged our strength as well as realized that the 'treasure' here was not what they were looking for. And thus, the crisis in Arsalan came to an end—and we threw a picture-perfect party in celebration.

mainline3c.questLineDesc: We decided to look for the origin of the 'treasure' to settle our ameeri problem once and for all. We went up north with the archaeologist to the crystal caves where we discovered secrets pertaining to Arsalan and even Sargon, but elite ameer forces showed up for our heads as well. We drove them off, and they acknowledged our strength as well as realized that the 'treasure' here was not what they were looking for. And thus, the crisis in Arsalan came to an end—and we threw a picture-perfect party in celebration.

sideline_miner.questLineDesc: We followed the lone warrior to the dried up riverbed. Together, we destroyed the ameeri quarry to rescue her comrades, and she thanked us for our efforts.

sideline_xbele.questLineDesc: The statue at the temple gate vanished leaving only mysterious tracks in its wake. We followed the trail and finally discovered the truth about the statue, and quite the hidden past behind it.

sideline_clking.questLineDesc: The 'treasure' drew in many irrelevants, and our old friend came to us too, hoping for us to find a treasure hunter. We met a troupe of acrobats in a small town, came across them again inside a crystal cave, and settled our little grievance.

sideline_cook.questLineDesc: The High Priest was suddenly in a bad mood, and we struggled to guess at what might placate this fussy 'senior's' tongue. We made a bunch of dishes in vain, and had to ask the one closest to him, Eunectes, for help to finally satisfy his request.

bonus_cook.questLineTitle: Rainforest Strange Flavor Candy easter egg
